events.summary: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with NPR's Geoff Brumfiel and Greg Myre about the upcoming meeting between Iran and the United States.

events.title: Basant: Lahore kite festival returns after decades-long ban
events.summary: Pakistanis are taking to rooftops across Lahore as they again celebrate the Basant festival by flying colorful kites above their city. The event had been banned due to the many deaths and injuries.

events.title: UN: 4.5 million girls at risk of genital mutilation in 2026
events.summary: Many of the girls at risk of FGM are under the age of 5, the UN says. Around 230 million women and girls around the world are survivors of the practice.

events.title: TrumpRx promises cheap drugs for the US ― but how cheap?
events.summary: Donald Trump's latest pitch to voters ahead of critical midterm elections is that he's bringing drug prices down. But amid cost-of-living challenges, many Americans may only see modest savings.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony: live updates
events.summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony is finally here. DW has the latest on the official opening to the 25th edition of the Games live in Milan.

events.title: Norway crown princess apologizes to royals for Epstein ties
events.summary: Mette-Marit's relationship with late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein comes as her son faces trial for rape and assault. The Epstein scandal is also affecting high-profile politicians in other European countries.

events.title: Greenland: Canada, France open consulates in Nuuk
events.summary: As the US needles EU and NATO allies with threats of taking Greenland from Denmark, Canada and France are opening new consulates on the Arctic island. Ottawa and Paris both say they want to boost Arctic security.

events.title: European nations gear up to ban social media for children
events.summary: Some experts have questioned how such a ban will be implemented and whether it will work. Meanwhile, the EU's flagship digital law is seen to be flailing in driving systematic changes on large online platforms.

events.title: Germany news: Merz wraps up Gulf investment charm offensive
events.summary: During a three-day visit to the Gulf region along with a business delegation, Chancellor Friedrich Merz tried to portray Germany as a reliable business partner. DW has more.

events.title: German train conductor's death highlights rise in violence
events.summary: Following a fatal attack on a railway employee, a debate has erupted in Germany about how such incidents can be prevented.

events.title: How Philippines' schools embraced German language
events.summary: Guten Morgen, the Philippines! German has found a home in the Philippines' public schools despite being a tough language to learn — even for some of the teachers.

events.title: Thailand 2026 election: What you need to know
events.summary: After cycling through three prime ministers in less than three years, Thai voters are going to the polls on Feb. 8. They will also decide whether to draft a new constitution to replace a current military-backed charter.

events.title: EU says TikTok's 'addictive design' harms children
events.summary: European Union regulators released preliminary findings that TikTok's constant flow of content puts users' brains into "autopilot mode." The social network has strongly rejected the accusations.

events.title: Sudanese refugee dentists rebuild care in Uganda
events.summary: Sudanese doctors who fled the war are rebuilding their medical careers in Kampala, offering free treatment to refugees and modern care for locals as they reconstruct a sense of purpose in exile.

events.title: Women's Bundesliga dispute shows no sign of ending
events.summary: The future of women’s football in Germany remains in limbo, with the country’s top league and its association (DFB) wrestling for control. Germany's top clubs are refusing to work with the DFB, at least for now.

events.title: German exports to US plummet, but Europe provides a boost
events.summary: The number of German goods sent to the US nosedived in 2025 due to tariffs, even as overall exports surprisingly rose, buoyed by orders from within Europe.

events.title: Could Hungary win its case against the EU's Russian gas ban?
events.summary: The EU has banned the import of all Russian gas by the end of 2027. Hungary is taking the matter to the European Court of Justice — and some legal experts think it might have a chance.

events.title: China grows while Europe slows in South American EV market
events.summary: China's electric carmakers are rapidly expanding across South America as Europe hesitates with trade liberalization. From Brazil to Argentina, a high-stakes battle is unfolding for the region's future auto market.

events.title: Pakistan: Dozens killed in blast at Islamabad Shiite mosque
events.summary: At least 31 people were killed after an explosion ripped through a Shiite place of worship in Tarlai on the outskirts of the Pakistani capital.

events.title: Defending Denmark against foes — and fickle friends
events.summary: Donald Trump's Greenland obsession has added pressure on the Danish military. Expanded conscription will boost its ranks as disappointment grows over the US attitude toward allies.

events.title: Cycle syncing exercise could optimize results for women
events.summary: Women in gyms hear it all the time: lift heavy in some weeks, go lighter in others, depending on your menstrual cycle — because your hormones affect your strength. But is it backed by science?

events.title: Germany: Rising concern over social inequality
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his conservatives have seen a dip in the polls. This follows weeks of debates over the latest controversial proposals to restructure Germany's welfare state.

events.title: Russian general hospitalized after 'several shots' in Moscow
events.summary: Russian officials said the deputy chief of military intelligence, Vladimir Alekseyev, was targeted by "an unidentified individual."

events.title: Berlin hospitals threatened by spate of attacks
events.summary: Hospitals in Germany's capital are reporting an increasing number of suspicious incidents, including cyberattacks, drone flights and arson. Experts warn that healthcare facilities are easy targets.

events.title: US ambassador cuts ties with Polish parliament speaker
events.summary: The diplomatic row comes after Sejm speaker Czarzasty said Donald Trump didn't "deserve" the Nobel Peace Prize. Poland is one of the US' closest allies in Europe and lies on NATO's eastern flank.

events.title: Berlin airport halts takeoffs, landings for second day
events.summary: The airport which serves Germany's capital and the surrounding Brandenburg state is cancelling flights as of Friday morning due to black ice and freezing rain.

events.title: Epstein files show Norwegian ex-PM Jagland's ties to sex offender
events.summary: Police have requested the revocation of Thorbjorn Jagland's immunity linked to his past position as a senior diplomat. He is among many high-profile figures facing scrutiny after the latest Epstein files release.

events.title: In freezing Kyiv, Ukrainians endure without heat, power
events.summary: In Kyiv, hundreds of thousands of residents are facing subzero temperatures without any heat or electricity. Mayor Vitali Klitschko has said municipal services are "working around the clock" to restore heat to homes.

events.title: UK's Keir Starmer struggles with Epstein Mandelson fallout
events.summary: The British prime minister apologized to Epstein victims in a speech, and accused his former US ambassador, Peter Mandelson, of telling "lies" to secure a spot in his government. Mandelson faces a police investigation.

events.title: Louvre to fully restore Empress Eugenie's crown after heist
events.summary: The Louve theves dropped Empress Eugenie's emerald crown when they fled the scene of the heist in October last year, leaving it badly dented. But the eight pieces they got away with still have not been found.

events.title: Albania's judicial reform 10 years on: Hope without justice
events.summary: In 2016, Albania launched a reform program aimed at strengthening its judiciary and making it a pillar in the fight against corruption. The murder of a judge last October has reignited the debate about this reform.

events.title: Russia expels German diplomat in tit-for-tat espionage row
events.summary: Russia has declared a military attache at the German Embassy in Moscow persona non grata. It called the move a response to Germany expelling a diplomat and accusing them of espionage, a charge the Kremlin rejects.

events.title: Why scientists warn of privately funded geoengineering
events.summary: As the climate crisis intensifies, interest in solar engineering is increasing, including among private companies and investors. But the technique is controversial and lacks regulation.

events.title: The fight for American football in Europe
events.summary: After the fall of the European League of Football, two rival organizations have emerged to fill the gap. Can they succeed where others, including the NFL, failed?

events.title: Trump to be exposed at Cologne Carnival's Rose Monday parade
events.summary: Donald Trump, Friedrich Merz and Emmanuel Macron are all targets of satirical floats at this year's Rose Monday Parade in Cologne. But Vladimir Putin will be spared — and there is a reason for that.

events.title: How US Project Vault challenges China's rare-earth dominance
events.summary: Donald Trump's Project Vault seeks to secure US access to rare earth minerals vital for advanced tech and clean energy. The EU wants a minerals alliance with Washington, but can they really shift China's outsized lead?

events.title: Germany news: Merz on Gulf tour talks arms deals in Doha
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz is on a three-day visit to the Gulf region as Germany seeks closer partnerships on business, energy and security.

events.title: Ukraine updates: POW swap deal reached at Abu Dhabi talks
events.summary: US envoy Steve Witkoff has announced that Ukraine and Russia agreed to exchange 314 prisoners for the first time in months, but said "significant work remains."

events.title: New START: Last US-Russia nuclear treaty expires, raising fears of new global arms race
events.summary: With the New START pact now expired, the US and Russia face no limits on their nuclear weapon stockpiles for the first time in decades. The UN warns the risk of nuclear use is now at its highest in decades.

events.title: Winter Olympics begin quietly with curling
events.summary: The mixed doubles curling event kicked off the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics two days before the official opening of the Games.

events.title: Turkey's textile industry crushed by China and Bangladesh
events.summary: Asian rivals have pushed Turkey's manufacturers out of EU markets. Factories are closing and jobs are vanishing. Is there still hope the industry can survive?

events.title: Court in Hungary declares German anti-fascist Maja T. guilty
events.summary: Maja T., a nonbinary anti-fascist activist from Germany, has been sentenced to eight years in prison in Budapest. The trial has been controversial and has political implications.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: What you need to know
events.summary: This Friday, the 25th Winter Olympics will open in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. How big will the Games be? Will Russia be allowed to participate in the competitions — and what about security and doping?

events.title: Gaza casualties 'hard to deny,' conflict monitors say
events.summary: Independent monitors have welcomed reports that the IDF now agrees with Palestinian casualty figures after years of denials. But whether in Gaza, Ukraine or other war zones, accurately gauging casualties is rarely easy.

events.title: World Cancer Day: Smoking, infections and alcohol cause 4 in 10 preventable cancer cases
events.summary: A new WHO study suggests that over 7 million cases of cancer in 2022 were preventable. Nearly 40% of all the cases that year were linked to modifiable risk factors — behavioral and environmental factors we can change.

events.title: Serbia: Reform denounced as a political takeover of justice
events.summary: In a rushed, opaque procedure, Serbia's ruling majority has pushed through legal amendments that critics say undermine judicial independence and are designed to neutralize the prosecutors investigating organized crime.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.summary: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Tackling forever chemicals could save money and our health
events.summary: Critics say a new UK plan to tackle forever chemicals does not match proposed measures in the EU. As European governments try to deal with the growing PFAS pollution, cleaning it up could cost up to €1.7 trillion.

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.summary: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies — and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: 'Global human rights system is in peril,' says HRW
events.summary: US President Donald Trump's reelection has put civil rights under threat globally, Human Rights Watch warned. The NGO's report includes violations in Germany.

events.title: Migrant boat collides with Greek coast guard vessel, 15 dead
events.summary: According to media reports, the Greek patrol boat issued a warning signal after spotting the migrant boat, which then tried to escape. For reasons that are still unclear, the two boats collided.

events.title: Germany and the Gulf region: Energy and arms deals
events.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is visiting three Gulf states within just 72 hours. He is pursuing new "strategic partnerships" — as Germany's friendship with the United States is becoming increasingly fragile.

events.title: Pieces of the Berlin Wall as souvenirs: Fake or the real deal?
events.summary: It's been nearly 40 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall but you can still buy pieces of it in the German capital as souvenirs. Are they genuine?

events.title: Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails
events.summary: Katie Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied the chance to reach her sixth Winter Olympics by rivals Canada. The top sports court has now blocked the US skeleton athlete's latest effort to compete.

events.title: FIFA boss Infantino wants Russia to return to football
events.summary: In a surprise statement, the head of world football has said he believes it is time for Russia to return to the pitch.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.summary: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Why gold and silver prices suddenly collapsed
events.summary: After hitting record highs last week, the prices of gold and silver have suddenly reversed course. DW looks at how a euphoric rally flipped into a sharp, confidence-shaking rout.

events.title: France's 2026 budget finally gets passed
events.summary: Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu's minority government made it through two no-confidence votes before finally getting his 2026 budget over the line.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.summary: Harold Kreis is set to head to his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: Vienna swaps parking for green space
events.summary: Conscious of reaching climate goals and strapped for space, some cities are reconsidering how much they dedicate to parking. Austria's capital, Vienna, is streets ahead.

events.title: Trump's Greenland 'piece of ice' remark echoes history
events.summary: Donald Trump's description of Greenland echoes a colonial pattern in which powerful states have dismissed sparsely populated land, ignoring Indigenous ties.

events.title: Germany news: Nationwide strikes hit public transport
events.summary: Many buses, trams and underground trains across the country will not be running amid a strike by a large union. Foreign Minister Wadephul is visiting Singapore. Read more in DW's running coverage of German news.

events.title: Handball: Germany lose to Denmark in Euro final
events.summary: Germany fell at the final hurdle at the European Men's Handball Championship, losing to co-hosts and favorites Denmark in the final. Two German players made the tournament all-star team.

events.title: Rita Süssmuth: The high-profile feminist reformer dies aged 88
events.summary: She dared to break taboos, advocated for women's rights and took part in a failed attempt to oust Chancellor Helmut Kohl as chairman of the CDU. Former President of the German Bundestag Rita Süssmuth has died aged 88.

events.title: Germany: Afghanistan's consulates pose threat to refugees
events.summary: Afghanistan's consulates in Germany are being taken over by Taliban officials, putting Afghan people at the mercy of the regime they fled.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Germany's AfD bonds with Austrian far-right extremists
events.summary: Officials from the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party have been openly rubbing shoulders with Austrian right-wing extremist Martin Sellner. This, despite reservations over his Identitarian Movement.

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: EU asylum policy: What changes for refugees in Germany?
events.summary: The German government is about to implement the EU's Common European Asylum System (CEAS) to limit irregular migration and speed up asylum procedures.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Fun events, but what about the bill?
events.summary: Preparations for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina have been far from perfect. Should the Olympics hosting model be changed?

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.summary: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Germany's Bundeswehr goes on military spending spree
events.summary: Germany is spending more on weapons and military equipment than ever before. For the first time, this also includes combat drones.

events.title: Anti-woke Germans in Russia used as propaganda for Putin
events.summary: Media in Moscow are selling a narrative of mass Western migration to Russia, especially from Germany. Numbers contradict the Kremlin's claims.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.summary: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.summary: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.summary: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: German development policy: Partners in the Global South
events.summary: The Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development is focusing on solidarity and partnership in turbulent geopolitical times. Alabali Radovan's trip to Sierra Leone in West Africa illustrates what this means.

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: CDU, Merz target 'lifestyle part-time' work in Germany
events.summary: A proposal from the economic wing of Germany’s CDU to place tighter restrictions on part-time contracts has come under heavy scrutiny. Chancellor Merz has repeatedly criticized the German work ethic in the past year.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.summary: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: How does Germany deport people?
events.summary: Germany does not have masked ICE officers or an equivalent agency, but both Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his predecessor have done all they can to accelerate deportations. Here's how the process works.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.summary: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: Germany's Green Party under pressure over Mercosur vote
events.summary: The Greens are big supporters of international agreements. But, now, eight German lawmakers in the European Parliament have all but scuppered the Mercosur free trade agreement — defying their party's leadership.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.summary: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: German FA boss says World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
events.summary: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Australian Open tennis encounters extreme heat
events.summary: Tournament organizers have instituted their extreme heat protocols amid blistering temperatures in the region.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: Berlin's young Jews reveal complex experiences with antisemitism
events.summary: Jewish people in Berlin have had varying experiences since October 7, 2023, but several DW spoke to say they have seen more antisemitism and have become increasingly cautious.

events.title: Germany, France, others rebuke Trump's NATO troop disrespect
events.summary: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said it would show "decency" for Donald Trump to apologize for comments on NATO troops in Afghanistan. "But we all know how the US president operates," Pistorius added.

events.title: Gold breaks $5,000: What's fueling the price rally and where will it end?
events.summary: Gold continues to hit record highs, having already had a bumper run in 2025. Geopolitical and economic uncertainty are the key factors, while doubts over the US dollar are also attracting new investors.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: Germany news: Bounty offered over Berlin power grid attack
events.summary: German authorities have offered a €1 million bounty for tips related to this month's massive Berlin blackout. Meanwhile, European leaders discussed energy and security cooperation in Hamburg. DW has more.

events.title: Calls grow for European teams to boycott World Cup 2026
events.summary: As with Russia in 2018 and Qatar in 2022, politics are dominating the buildup to North America's 2026 World Cup. Could discontent with Donald Trump in Europe see football heavyweights unite to boycott the tournament?

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Rodman becomes new 'highest paid' women's footballer
events.summary: USA forward Trinity Rodman has re-signed with the Washington Spirit of the National Women's Soccer League in a deal that will reportedly pay her in excess of $2 million per season.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Davos WEF: Trump touts policies, renews Greenland ambitions
events.summary: Donald Trump used his WEF speech to praise himself and lash out at Europe while offering little on the economy. Business and political leaders were expecting the worst, but much of it was for a domestic audience.

events.title: European Parliament votes to delay Mercosur deal in court
events.summary: Lawmakers voted narrowly to challenge the EU trade deal with Latin America in the bloc's top court, a move that could derail the deal. Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the deal should be provisionally enacted anyway.

events.title: Free solo climb on Netflix: 'If you fall, you're gonna die'
events.summary: Rock climber Alex Honnold plans to scale the facade of what was once the world's tallest building — live on Netflix. But not all are impressed by the idea.

events.title: Apple overtakes Samsung in phones sales worldwide
events.summary: After 14 years behind Samsung, Apple is back on top in global smartphone sales, just as Chinese rivals step up the pressure. Foldables and advanced AI are the new battleground in the fight for the next billion users.

events.title: WEF in Davos: Is Greenland the wake-up call Europe needed?
events.summary: Europe faces waning influence amid wars, trade tensions, climate inaction and a US administration quick to hurl insults at its oldest allies. In Davos, leaders discuss how Europe can regain its mojo.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Iran's economic woes expose regime's tight grip
events.summary: As religious elites and Revolutionary Guards strengthen their hold on the economy, experts question how long the regime can survive.

events.title: African fans fume at 'disgraceful' World Cup travel ban
events.summary: Senegal's football team are champions of Africa, but fans from the country are banned from going to the US for the World Cup. They aren't the only ones, with Donald Trump's hostility and FIFA ticket prices hitting hard.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: Why Germany probably won't get political at 2026 World Cup
events.summary: After their very public protest at the last World Cup in Qatar, Germany's football team looks unlikely to do the same in the United States in 2026.

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: NBA Europe to 'respect' European basketball tradition
events.summary: The NBA is pressing ahead with plans to launch a basketball league in Europe, with a slated launch date of 2027.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: Women poised to take India sports to the next level
events.summary: India has been experiencing major growth in women's sports in recent years. This is being fuelled by investment from both the public and private sector – as well as many role models.

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: Epstein files special: Revelations, Redactions & Ramifications
events.summary: In a week where global headlines have been dominated, daily, by the fall out from what the Trump administration calls, “The final release”, of files, compelled to act by US law to make public unclassified records related to Jeffrey Epstein, in order to bring full transparency into Epstein’s dark world of child sex abuse and trafficking.

events.title: Exclusive: Iran, massacre under a blackout
events.summary: In this exclusive documentary, FRANCE 24 retraces the chronology of events that took place in Iran from December 28, 2025, when merchants in Tehran's Grand Bazaar went on strike, to January 18, 2026, when the authorities restored internet access. Behind closed doors, from January 8 to 11, Iran's worst massacre took place since the 1979 establishment of the Islamic Republic. Warning: viewers may find the footage and descriptions in this report upsetting.

events.title: Menswear collections, autumn-winter 2026/27: Resisting a toxic world
events.summary: For some designers, fashion is less about clothes themselves, and more about what those clothes can convey. They see fashion as primarily a political endeavour, a means of challenging a status quo that too often seeks to erase the individual for the alleged benefit of the social order. They champion diversity, gender fluidity and disruption. Jeanne Friot, Walter van Beirendonck, Ahmed Hassan, Louis-Gabriel Nouchi, Yohji Yamamoto and Willy Chavarria are among the group's most outspoken voices. FRANCE 24 checks out their latest collections.

events.title: Why public transport fails to protect women
events.summary: From Tokyo to Toronto, Delhi to Paris, millions of women plan their journeys: choosing where to sit, when to travel, and how to stay alert. More than 70 percent of women worldwide have encountered sexual harassment in public spaces, including on transit. Here in France, the number of victims of sexual violence on public transport, recorded by law enforcement, has increased by 86 percent in almost a decade. Some 91 percent of victims are women.

events.title: Port dispute thrusts Panama Canal back into heart of US-China rivalry
events.summary: A court decision stripping a Chinese-linked company of key port contracts in the Panama Canal has triggered a backlash from Beijing, thrusting the strategic waterway back into the spotlight – and highlighting China’s struggle to maintain influence in a region Washington regards as its backyard.

events.title: Pakistan: Massive explosion at Shiite mosque leaves dozens dead
events.summary: A bombing at a Shiite mosque on the outskirts of Islamabad during Friday prayers killed 31 people and wounded at least 169, marking one of the deadliest attacks in the capital in nearly two decades. Officials are investigating whether it was a suicide attack. Residents criticized authorities for failing to ensure security, while Pakistan continues to face a surge in militant attacks targeting Shiites and ongoing insurgency in Balochistan.

events.title: Japan's 'iron lady' hopes to consolidate power in snap election
events.summary: From a K-pop drum duet to a feud with China to an extra-early election, Japan's PM Sanae Takaichi has had quite a roller-coaster ride in her first three months in office. Riding on a wave of popularity, the hardline conservative dissolved parliament and called an election nearly three years early in a bid to regain a single-party majority and consolidate her hold on power. We take a closer look at Japan's "iron lady" and her policies since becoming the country's first female leader.

events.title: Iran’s complexity in heart of Middle East: Islamic Republic 'created, grown & flourished in crisis'
events.summary: Catherine Viette is pleased to welcome Dr. Anahita Motazed-Rad, visiting senior fellow in the Department of International Relations at the London School of Economics. As a scholar of international relations and someone deeply attuned to the strategic mindset of both Tehran and Washington, she sees this moment not as one of open confrontation, but rather a tactical crossroads. From US engaging in chest-thumping 'diplomacy' to Iran's raison d'etre of brutally weathering multiple existential crises.

events.title: Bad Bunny at Super Bowl, Mariah Carey at Olympics opening ceremony
events.summary: FRANCE 24's Charli James previews a big weekend in arts and entertainment. Bad Bunny promises a "huge party" for everyone at the Super Bowl Halftime Show. Also, Mariah Carey sings in Italian at the 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony. Plus, a new light show opens in Bordeaux featuring the colours of Henri Matisse and Frida Kahlo.

events.title: Haiti teeters on brink as transitional council’s mandate ends
events.summary: Haiti faces worsening instability as its Transitional Presidential Council’s mandate expires, with little progress toward elections, rampant gang violence, humanitarian crises, and US-backed efforts to maintain political order amid ongoing insecurity.

events.title: Thousands attend Gaddafi son’s funeral, highlighting Libya’s divided loyalties
events.summary: Thousands of mourners gathered in the western Libyan town of Bani Walid on Friday for the funeral of former Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi's son, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, who was killed this week. The turnout in a town that has long been a Gaddafi stronghold underscored the divisions that have split Libya since the 2011 Arab Spring uprising, plunging the country into instability.

events.title: US arrests ‘key participant’ in deadly 2012 Benghazi consulate attack
events.summary: The US has arrested and extradited a "key participant" in the 2012 attack on its consulate in Benghazi, Libya, which killed four Americans, including Ambassador Chris Stevens, Attorney General Pam ​Bondi said Friday. The suspect will face charges in a US court. The attack was a divisive political issue, with Republicans accusing Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton of security failures.

events.title: Brutal Duvalier regime to Haiti in disarray: 'Democracy Spring' derailed by coups, militias, gangs
events.summary: Peter O'Brien is pleased to welcome Harold Isaac, joining us from Port-au-Prince, Haiti. He affirms what we're witnessing today is not really the sudden collapse of order, but the decades-long unraveling of a nation’s road to democracy, forged in the ashes of dictatorship and derailed by a toxic mix of perpetual internal conflict and external indifference. With the Transitional Presidential Council's mandate ending and no clear path forward, Haiti finds itself at another crossroads.

events.title: BTS reunion will be biggest K-pop concert event in history
events.summary: After a four-year hiatus for military service, the boys of BTS are coming back and Netflix is streaming it worldwide. Plus: Timothée Chalamet feels the love from fans in Paris at the "Marty Supreme" premiere and we look at how AI is being used to produce popular vertical drama series even quicker and cheaper.

events.title: Trump video showing Obamas as monkeys sparks outrage over 'vile' racist depiction
events.summary: President Donald Trump posted an election conspiracy video depicting former president Barack Obama and his wife Michelle as monkeys, drawing condemnations over the racist portrayal of America's first and only Black president. The White House on Friday initially dismissed the criticism as "fake outrage" before deleting the post and claiming the video had been “erroneously” made by a staffer.

events.title: Estonia’s border town caught in a diplomatic standoff between NATO and Russia
events.summary: Estonia's Narva has become a tense microcosm of the NATO-Russia standoff. Since 2022, Estonia has fortified the border with anti-tank obstacles and moved to sever ties with Moscow. In this 95% Russian-speaking town, the government has mandated Estonian in schools and recently banned Russian citizens from local voting. Amid Russian provocations like removing border buoys, residents feel increasingly torn between two worlds.

events.title: 'Casualties expected to rise' in Pakistan after deadly mosque suicide attack
events.summary: A suicide bomber killed at least 31 people and wounded nearly 170 during Friday prayers at a Shi’ite mosque in Islamabad, officials said, marking the deadliest attack of its kind in the capital in over a decade. Officials suspect a branch of the Taliban may be behind the attack, though this has not been confirmed. The bombing comes as Uzbek officials visit the country and Pakistani forces conduct training operations in the region, as FRANCE 24’s Hamza Azhar reports.

events.title: Nuclear deal talks resume as US presses Iran on wider issues
events.summary: The United States and Iran have begun talks in Oman on a potential new nuclear deal, the first since US and Israeli strikes on Iran’s nuclear programme last June. While both sides say the nuclear issue is central, Washington wants to broaden the discussions to include Iran’s missiles and human rights record, demands Tehran has rejected. The talks are taking place amid ongoing regional tensions.

events.title: 'We will not accept to be treated badly': MEP Brando Benifei, EU's point man for US relations
events.summary: Shared economic and security interests still bind Europe and the United States, even as trust has eroded, insults have flown and rhetoric has hardened in the transatlantic relationship, Brando Benifei, the chair of the delegation for relations with the United States at the European Parliament, tells FRANCE 24 in Talking Europe.

events.title: Indirect US–Iran talks open in Oman amid tensions
events.summary: Washington and Tehran have resumed indirect talks in Oman for the first time since June, with discussions mediated by Omani officials. The agenda has not been made public, though Iran’s nuclear programme is expected to feature, alongside US concerns over Iran’s domestic crackdown. The talks come amid ongoing tensions and uncertainty over whether further meetings will follow, as FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah explains from Tehran.

events.title: Starlink used by Russian forces deactivated on battlefield, Ukraine says
events.summary: Ukraine said on Thursday that Starlink internet terminals used by Russian forces on the battlefield have been deactivated, disrupting Moscow’s military operations in several areas. The move comes after discussions between Ukrainian officials and Elon Musk. Russia had relied on thousands of Starlink units for mobile, hard-to-disrupt communications, particularly for drone operations, and has few effective alternatives.

events.title: No food, no shelter, no money: the daily fight for survival in Gaza
events.summary: After two years of war, the October ceasefire brought a precarious calm to Gaza – despite the fact that Israeli strikes have not completely stopped. While some shops have reopened, most of the enclave's two million inhabitants are still living in makeshift shelters and have little to no income. FRANCE 24 spoke to residents who say they face a daily fight for survival.

events.title: Greenland crisis further damages transatlantic ties: Time for a major strategic rethink?
events.summary: Europe has experienced numerous crises since Donald Trump returned to the White House: on trade and tariffs; on Ukraine; and perhaps the most surreal one – on Greenland. The latter was unprecedented: NATO's leading member, the US, openly expressing its territorial designs on another NATO member, Denmark. With each emergency, the same calls have been heard for Europe to wake up and take its destiny into its own hands. But how should the EU and the European members of NATO actually make a strategic shift? We put the question to two MEPs.

events.title: US sends group troops to Nigeria to address terrorism threat
events.summary: Suspected jihadist gunmen killed dozens in Woro Village, leaving the community devastated. While Amnesty International called the attack a 'stunning security failure,' President Bola Tinubu has ordered a Nigerian army battalion to the area to restore order. The UN condemned the violence, and the US administration has expressed a desire to send troops on the ground to assist Nigeria in its fight against terrorism.

events.title: Mystery as Russian general shot at close range - with equally curious response from the Kremlin
events.summary: From the Skripal poisonings to the invasion of Ukraine to subverting American elections, it is hard to think of a Russian outrage Lieutenant General Vladimir Alekseyev has not been involved in.

events.title: Winter Olympics under way with spectacular opening ceremony
Pakistan suicide bombing leaves at least 31 dead and 169 injured
events.summary: At least 31 people have been killed and 169 injured in a suicide bombing in Pakistan.

events.title: Norway's crown princess apologises for Epstein ties
events.summary: Norway's crown princess Mette-Marit has apologised for her friendship with Jeffrey Epstein after the latest release of files about the late convicted sex offender.

events.title: Iran and US to begin high-stakes talks amid fears of conflict
events.summary: Iranian and American officials will kick off face-to-face talks in Oman today, following weeks of threatened military action by Donald Trump.

events.title: North Korea 'executes schoolchildren for watching Squid Game'
events.summary: People in North Korea, including schoolchildren, are being executed for watching Squid Game and other foreign media, according to new testimony.

events.title: British man holidaying in Spain with wife and children falls to death from hotel balcony
events.summary: A British man has died after falling from the sixth-floor balcony of a hotel in Spain.

events.title: Winter Olympics hit by penis enhancement controversy
events.summary: Crotch enhancements. Banned helmets. Qualifying manipulation claims. And Russian hacking.

events.title: One dead, three injured after Dublin bus crash
events.summary: One person has died, and three others have been hurt after a double-decker bus crashed into pedestrians in Dublin city centre.

events.title: Historic crown crushed during Louvre heist pictured
events.summary: The crown of French Empress Eugenie recovered after last year's Louvre heist was left damaged - but remains largely intact and will be restored, the museum has said.

events.title: British man sentenced to nearly 24 years for drugging and abusing boys at summer camp
events.summary: A 76-year-old retired British veterinarian has been sentenced to 23 years and 10 months in prison on charges of child abuse after lacing candy he gave to his victims with sedatives at a summer camp last year

events.title: Most victims in migrant boat collision in Greece had severe head injuries, diver says
events.summary: A diver who helped recover bodies from a deadly collision between a boat carrying migrants and a Greek coast guard vessel says most of the 15 people who died had suffered severe head injuries, as questions mounted over the circumstances of the incident

events.title: A family's solitary fight to save endangered plants in the Amazon
events.summary: Ramón Pucha ventures into the Ecuadorian Amazon jungle to collect seeds from endangered plant species

events.title: After Epstein fallout, UK leader Starmer faces hurdles and rivals as he battles to keep his job
events.summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer is facing a battle to stay in post in the wake of the fallout of his decision in 2024 to appoint veteran Labour politician Peter Mandelson as the U.K. ambassador to the U.S. despite his ties to the pedophile Jeffrey ...

events.title: Facing Trump tariffs, Africa's leading economy says it's close to China trade deal
events.summary: China and South Africa have signed a framework agreement for a new trade deal

events.title: Deal is signed in Beirut to transfer 300 Syrian prisoners in Lebanon to their home country
events.summary: Lebanon and Syria have signed an agreement to transfer over 300 Syrian detainees from Lebanese prisons to continue their sentences in Syria

events.title: Norway investigates former prime minister over Epstein ties
events.summary: Norway has opened an aggravated corruption investigation into former prime minister Thorbjørn Jagland

events.title: Pope, an avid athlete, extols physical and spiritual benefits of sport in Olympic message
events.summary: Pope Leo XIV, an avid tennis player, marks the start of the Winter Games by praising sports for promoting positive values and fair play

events.title: Russia and US discussed nuclear arms and agreed talks need to start soon, Kremlin says
events.summary: The Kremlin says Russian and U.S. negotiators have discussed the expiration of their last remaining nuclear arms pact

events.title: The death toll from a bombing at a Shiite mosque on Islamabad's outskirts has risen to 24, a Pakistani official says
events.summary: The death toll from a bombing at a Shiite mosque on Islamabad's outskirts has risen to 24, a Pakistani official says

events.title: Canada and France opening consulates in Greenland following tensions over US push for control
events.summary: Canada and France are opening diplomatic consulates in the capital of Greenland

events.title: A bombing at a Shiite mosque in Islamabad kills at least 31 and wounds dozens
events.summary: A Pakistani police official says the death toll from a massive bombing that tore through a Shiite mosque on the outskirts of the capital, Islamabad, during Friday prayers has risen to 31

events.title: Rescuers search for woman swept away by river as Spain and Portugal battle Storm Leonardo
events.summary: Storm Leonardo is battering the Iberian Peninsula and causing widespread disruption

events.title: Cuba's power outages and other top photos from Latin America and the Caribbean
events.summary:
Jan. 30 - Feb. 1, 2026

Cubans getting by without power as outages persist and tensions with US escalate. Argentina fires ravage pristine Patagonia forests. After Mexico bans vapes, cartels tighten their grip on a booming market.

This gallery was curated by photo editor Anita Baca, based in Mexico City.
